author: andreassosilo
title: DID for Cardano Indonesia Community
description: Accelerate the ++adoption of decentralized identities (DIDs)++ in the Cardano Community.

author: bernardomendonca
title: Stackable Learning Pathways
description: Today's factory-based education model is flawed. The average-size-fits-all model ignores individual variability in learning and development.

author: dwayne
title: DAO-NET
description: Function specific DAOs that provide services to DAOs can form the basis for exponential DID growth however DAOs require a legal framework.

author: danbonfil
title: LATAM Community DID
description: SSI/DID are hardly know in LATAM, let alone their benefits. If there is no community empowerment or sense of belonging; adoption wont follow

author: dtpt
title: Voting & ID - ANONYMOUS Enabled
description: Decentralized Voting featuring Full ID Anonymous ID Voting, with One Person equals One Vote is needed and a requirement of $DTPT.

author: ouroboros
title: Building a Network of Trust
description: In a large network, we want to be able to build trustworthy relationships. We need means to know if someone is trusted by our peers.

author: sessionizill
title: DID for Music Business Backend
description: We're building a music streaming platform. Not anyone can upload, or it will be the Wild West. Only vetted record labels. We need DID.

author: essbante
title: WAL-CLI Wallet-Tool for Developers
description: A tool with wallet capabilities is needed to accelerate prototyping and development of Atala PRISM projects

author: tim.heidfeld
title: Global Identity and Authentication
description: Without identity, there is: no ownership, no economic progress, no prosperity, no legally binding actions.

author: swong
title: Bottom-up land registration(Zambia)
description: Over one billion of the world's poor lack legally recognized land rights, locking them out of the financial system.

author: josec
title: Students dropping out of college
description: Only 55% will graduate college. Dropouts place a burden on the government that costs nearly 40B USD to society every year in the US alone.

author: yogo
title: Traveler Identity
description: Traveler info is saved in multiple centralized websites like Expedia and the user does not have any control over it.

author: tiago
title: Pioneer Program Kick-Off In Person
description: Communities need face-to-face interactions in order to build strong relationships, develop plans, and lay foundation for success.

author: pace
title: PACE: Community credentials 2
description: There is a lack of bottoms up community focussed credentials that help with both the adoption and education of Atala PRISM

author: pace
title: PACE: Skills credentials
description: There is a lack of verifiable credentials that allow people to verify their skills and showcase them to the Cardano community

author: rodolfo.miranda
title: Hyperledger-Prism Interoperability
description: How can Atala Prism exchange credentials with Hyperledger Indy where most of the credentials reside?

author: megrimlance
title: Open Source Credential Wallet
description: There is no Atala Prism identity wallet available to store and operate with Verifiable Credentials.

author: rodolfo.miranda
title: Interoperability within Atala Prism
description: How can we have a common pattern of credential schemas to share between Atala Prism projects?

author: arthurgreef
title: Cardano Circular Economy Ecosystem
description: Circular economy participants need to prove their products' compliance with sustainability regulations and commitments in private.

author: kuni
title: Atala Japanese Translation ＆ CNFT
description: In order to promote AtalaPrism and attract development engineers in Japan, the fact that all program materials is in English is a barrier.

author: gsaunyama
title: Farmers Digital Identity Initiative
description: The lack of ID infrastructure limits accessibility to financial services for small-scale farmers in Ethiopia

author: kylek
title: Open Source Social Account Verifier
description: It shouldn't be so hard to verify someone's control of a social account, email, etc; exchange info; and limit platform silos and censorship.

author: jeffrey.downard
title: DIDs for Health Records
description: How to promote widespread adoption of Atala Prism for health records?

author: jeffrey.downard
title: DIDs for Cities
description: How to promote widespread adoption of Atala Prism for DIDs?

author: gabrielaxel
title: Edu-to-action DAO squads
description: Education should be flexible, adaptable to present global needs. However, TradEdu is career-static & skills can quickly become obsolete.

author: tefera
title: Port BrightID
description: Despite the promise of self sovereign identity most implementations depend on centralized verification and are not user friendly.

author: rodolfo.miranda
title: KYC Verified Credential Issuer
description: How can projects comply with Know Your Customer regulations?

author: francek
title: Web 3.0 user profile (web avatar)
description: Web users should be allowed to create, edit and control their own user profile. Why create the same user profile on different websites?

author: gauravkgs
title: Backgound Verification (BVG)
description: BVG requires confidential documents passing through many hands and there are many interaction points where this can leak, lets make it safe.

author: nathan.bogale
title: Agricultural Marketplace + Atala
description: Ironically, In an $8Trllion globally estimated business of Agriculture, farmers do not decide on the price of their yields when sold out.

author: tobrien
title: Fair Supply Chain in Ghana
description: Oligopolies that form within supply chain governance boards may dictate economically disadvantageous terms to smallholder farmers.

author: jochen.leinberger
title: Open Source Identity Wallet
description: The Cardano Ecosystem is missing an open source wallet which is capable to handle Digital Identities.

author: bsandmann
title: P2P Transactions based on Trust
description: Lack of trust in places where there is no central marketplace with reviews and ratings facilitates fraud and leads to inefficient economies

author: submarine7
title: Atala PRISM tools for web apps
description: People use popular web frameworks without the decentralized identities' functionalities to build blogs, shops, etc for the web every day.

author: manfo2021
title: Dev Journey into DID/SSI* Paradigm
description: The change brought about by the DID paradigm is groundbreaking for conventional devs; at this stage practical use cases are not available.

author: amedina
title: Government Trust Frameworks
description: Interoperable standards for the decentralized identifiers like those used by Cardano have limited legal recognition, which slows adoption.

author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Self Governed Gaming [Revelar+Duo]
description: Identify verification and asset ownership confirmation in NFT games can be facilitated with decentralized IDs.

author: chris42
title: Cardano for Global Health Supply
description: The "Last Mile" problem in the campaign brief blocks delivery of diagnostics to prevent transmission of HIV, TB and other diseases in Africa

author: lena.kemna
title: Understanding the Cardano community
description: To grow the Cardano network, we first have to deeply understand it: How do people use it? What do they value? How could it be more communal?

author: geekship
title: SOIL: BITs
description: People lack motivation to learn about decentralized identity, or get involved with crypto ecosystems in general.

author: pxpepex
title: Verifiable Credentials Tree
description: The Portuguese fund distribution and assessment is a complicated process and lacks transparency from government and companies.

author: alexp7
title: DWill - Cardanos Digital Testament
description: Digital assets inheritance is growing pain and very difficult to manage.

author: fsamvura
title: Make Atala Prism DID THE Standard
description: Digital Identities can be created differently. Adoption and Usage will rely on Conformity, and Interoperability. A Standard is Key.

author: sbpabon
title: DII-Smart Contracts interactions
description: Local goverments in developing countries with absolute control over the Governance Framework in many of the most vital social processes

author: heinz.gassner
title: DID Application Blueprint
description: DID projects often jump early into programming solutions, without having sufficiently focused on a rock-solid underlaying architecture

author: reshm
title: Win-Win Prism DID Integration
description: Win-Win, a new alternate dispute resolution marketplace powered by Cardano, needs a mechanism to trustfully connect mediators with clients.

author: lewissk
title: Giving DIDs and VCs a push
description: Our industry needs Digital Identity and Verifiable Credentials now. Institutions and governments are moving too slowly. Let's fix this!

author: chrisr
title: Cardano Interop NOW
description: Decentralized Digital Identity using VCs and DIDs is booming but faces infrastructure bottlenecks. Cardano interop will accelerate adoption.

author: nftdao
title: DID for the Masses
description: Atala PRISM DID as a gateway to the Cardano blockchain & ecosystem, requires use cases to enable market penetration besides just government.

author: iain.bell
title: Medical Industry Credential System
description: Doctors are required to provide a range of government agency proofs of certification prior to being accepted for employment at any hospital.

author: mavster04
title: Health DAO
description: Healthcare data is the most popular target among hackers. It costs the highest at $408 per record. How Atala PRISM help in this regard?

author: reshm
title: Trustful Fundraising Campaigns
description: There is no trustful platform for fundraising campaigns to be used by any entity who wants to run a campaign.

author: amolagg
title: (DEI): Decentralized Exam identity
description: We currently lack secure and a decentralized identity system which can be operated by every student individually.

author: elementarysoftware
title: Visual DID & Credential Builder
description: Not all users are developers and the lack of intuitive UI tools exclude non-developers from creating and issue credentials to DID owners

author: heikki.ruhanen
title: Recruitment utilising Atala PRISM
description: Obtaining valid certifications for job recruitment is a major obstacle in labor markets of developing countries

author: zakanick
title: No-Code SSI SaaS for mass adoption
description: Adoption of SSI is low because people have no easy tools for creating interoperable & goal-oriented credential workflows.
